rules.summary: Arbitration proceedings are governed by the ICSID Convention, the Arbitration Rules, and any party agreement. The Rules operate as binding constraints.
Requires identification of parties and authorised representatives and submission of proper authority documentation.
Governs filing, routing, and service of documents through the ICSID Secretariat to ensure equal notice.
Allows the Tribunal to determine the language of the arbitration, subject to party submissions and fairness.
Establishes strict timelines and procedure for proposals to disqualify arbitrators.
Requires a first procedural session to organise the arbitration and determine the procedural framework.
Regulates written submissions and prevents unscheduled or excessive filings without Tribunal authorisation.
Regulates hearings, including format, conduct, and the opportunity for parties to present oral arguments.
Requires decisions of the Tribunal to be taken by a majority of its members.
Confirms the Tribunal’s power to call for evidence and regulate the burden of proof.
Allows bifurcation of proceedings at the discretion of the Tribunal.
Regulates preliminary objections, including timing and sequencing with merits.
Defines closure of proceedings and triggers the timeline for rendering the award.
Provides an optional expedited arbitration regime with compressed timelines and procedural simplifications.
